item.title: Induced Fit, Conformational Selection, and Independent Dynamic Segments: An Extended View of Binding Events
item.description: A 2010 Cell review expanding the classical models of protein-ligand binding to a dynamic landscape of conformational selection, induced fit, and independent dynamic segments. The paper highlights how ‘NOISE’—conformational fluctuations—can amplify signaling and regulate allosteric interactions, reshaping our understanding of binding and protein communication.

item.title: How Do Kinases Transfer Phosphoryl Groups
item.description: Notes on 1998 Cell review discussing kinase phosphoryl transfer mechanisms, conformational dynamics, cofactor roles, and binding motifs. Highlights the debate between associative (SN2) and dissociative (SN1) pathways, with structural evidence for both models.
